comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: This Florence Gilbert is probably the one listed as a debutante for the 1915-16 season. There's a large image of her as a debutante here: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0613F83E5E13738... Florence Emily Gilbert, daughter of Mrs. Cyril P. W. Dugmore and the Henry Bramhall Gilbert (1861-1911), married Sgt. Russell Evans Tucker at her mother's Park Avenue home, April 1918. Florence's mother, Lilla Brokaw Gilbert Dugmore: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2404816631/] (Mrs. Dugmore's maiden name is mentioned in her cousin Irving Brokaw's wikipedia entry: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irving_Brokaw )

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: pennylrichardsca: thanks for the link to the New York Times image of Florence Gilbert.  She does look like the same woman in the Bain image. We will update the description with more details.
